hints.content:
We can turn the rule into numbers and math symbols:

Rule: $\maroonD{\text{Multiply }} \blueD x \maroonD{\text{ by 2}}$.  Then $\greenD{\text{add 5}}$ to the result to get $\goldD y$.

$\blueD x \maroonD{\times 2} \greenD{+5} = \goldD y$

Now we can use the rule to  complete the  table: 

$x$ | |$y$ 
:-: | :-: 
$\blueD0$ |  $\blueD0 \maroonD{\times2}\greenD{+5} =  \goldD5$ | $\goldD5$
$\blueD1$ |  $\blueD1 \maroonD{\times2}\greenD{+5} =  \goldD7$  | $\goldD7$
$\blueD2$ | $\blueD2 \maroonD{\times2}\greenD{+5} =  \goldD9$ |$\goldD9$

Each pair of $x$ and $y$ values in the table represents an ordered pair and a point on the graph. 

The ordered pairs are:  $(0, 5), (1, 7),$ and $(2, 9)$.

Now let's graph each point.

Each $x$ value represents a number on the horizontal axis.

Each $y$ value represents a number on the vertical axis.

To graph the point $(\blueD0,\goldD5)$, go right on the $x$-axis $\blueD0$ spaces and up on the $y$-axis $\goldD5$ spaces.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/2d46d33843b8feb5d4173ac37d1295a7f808c1e0)

To graph the point $(\blueD1,\goldD7)$, go right on the $x$-axis $\blueD1$ space and up on the $y$-axis $\goldD7$ spaces.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/556d62ec8af9c231a486e838fcd7f2253f41db3d)

To graph the point $(\blueD2,\goldD9)$, go right on the $x$-axis $\blueD2$ spaces and up on the $y$-axis $\goldD9$ spaces.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/810c2885cdfe5fe1e9427c1780a6e6b6dc6fc775)

Here are the completed table and graph:

$x$ | $y$ 
:-: | :-: 
$0$ | $5$
$1$ |  $7$
$2$ |  $9$

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/8b7b764f21c0eada3d11e163c927153d00844e40)

$\blueD2$ |  $\blueD 2\maroonD{\times 4}\greenD{-3}=  \goldD5\\$      | $\goldD5$
$\blueD3$ | $\blueD 3\maroonD{\times 4}\greenD{-3}  =  \goldD9\\$   |$\goldD9$
Each ordered pair in the table represents a point on a graph. We need to see which graph contains the points $(1, 1), (2, 5)$, and $(3, 9)$.

Here is the completed table and the graph that shows the points from the table:

$x$ | $y$ 
:-: | :-: 
$1$ |  $1$
$2$ |  $5$
$3$ |  $9$
